title: Hanson Park Conservancy runs COVID-19 Memorial Bench fundraiser
body: COVID-19 has taken the lives of more than 150 residents of Cranford. Hanson Park Conservancy would like to honor those lives by placing a Memorial Bench next to the Butterfly Garden. Painting by Jane Ramsey.According to the Hanson Park Conservancy, COVID-19 has taken the lives of more than 150 residents of Cranford. The HPC would like to honor those lives by placing a Memorial Bench next to the Butterfly Garden –– a “beautiful and serene place for remembrance and reflection.”All proceeds from the fundraiser will go directly to the memorial. Those interested are welcome to contribute “any dollar amount that you wish towards this memorial.” The bench is expected to be installed later this year and will include a plaque in tribute to those lost.The unique Hanson Park benches are hand made by a craftsman in upstate New York. They were chosen as part of the original design which envisioned a passive environmentally sensitive park along the Rahway River.Tax exempt contributions can be made by mailing a check directly to HPC PO Box 542, Cranford, NJ 07016, visiting , or going to the HPC Facebook page.Visit the park at 38 Springfield Ave., Cranford. Details on the bench installation will be provided at a later date.Note to readers: if you purchase something through one of our affiliate links we may earn a commission.
